The API Lifecycle: Powered by OpenAPI Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(3) How OpenAPI Changed the Way We Work

  • Before OpenAPI: API behavior often only documented informally or post-implementation
  • Early tools focused on documentation generation from code comments
  • OpenAPI enabled design-first workflows and contract-driven tooling
  • New ecosystems emerged: editors, linters, test tools, SDK generators, portals
  • OpenAPI turned API definitions into code artifacts not just documentation


The API Lifecycle: Powered by OpenAPI Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(4) Tooling for API Providers

  • API Design & Documentation
  • Mocking API Responses
  • API Code Generation
  • API Testing & Validation
  • API Gateway & Security Configuration


The API Lifecycle: Powered by OpenAPI Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(5) Tooling for API Consumers

  • API Discovery & Integration
  • Client SDK & Code Generation
  • Automated Contract Testing
  • API Monitoring & Observability
  • API Versioning & Change Management


The API Lifecycle: Powered by OpenAPI Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(6) Description or Code First?

  • Both methods are means to an end with different emphases
  • The goal is to provide APIs with some level of coherence and governance
  • Many organizations use both methods in different places
  • Governance helps with managing the quality of the API landscape
  • Invest in API literacy as a way to treat APIs as a first-class concept

Editing OpenAPI: Beyond JSON and YAML Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(8) Editing: Why

  • Editing JSON or YAML is tedious and error-prone
  • Tools reduce errors and can ease understanding
  • Going API First improves API practices in organizations
  • Tools improve understanding for non-experts


Editing OpenAPI: Beyond JSON and YAML Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(13) Does API Quality Matter?



Why Linting? Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(14) It Depends!

  • Quality is in the eye of the beholder
  • Quality is determined by a number of factors
    • Consumer profile: Private, partner, public
    • Number of consumers: One, dozens, thousands
    • Context: Solitary or part of an API landscape
    • Exposed Service: Data, Transaction, Events
    • Lifecycle: early, stable, established
    • Tooling: Support for certain features


Why Linting? Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(19) Spectral: Open Source OpenAPI Linting

  • Powerful linter for JSON/YAML-based API descriptions like OpenAPI
  • Enforces consistency and quality across APIs by using rulesets
  • Built-in rules or custom rules tailored to organizational standards
  • Spectral can lint individual APIs or entire landscapes via CI/CD
  • Useful for both educational feedback and automated governance


Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(20) The Usual, Please!

  • Spectral has a large set of built-in rules for OpenAPI [https://docs.stoplight.io/docs/spectral/4dec24461f3af-open-api-rules]
    • Spectral also has built-in rules for AsyncAPI [https://docs.stoplight.io/docs/spectral/1e63ffd0220f3-async-api-rules] and Arazzo [https://docs.stoplight.io/docs/spectral/96c7245b504b1-arazzo-rules]
extends:
  - spectral:oas
  - spectral:asyncapi
  - spectral:arazzo
  • ruleset-builtin.yaml


Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(21) Minimal Spectral



Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(22) No Onions and Extra Cheese, Please!

  • Rules in rulesets can be selectively tweaked or turned off [https://docs.stoplight.io/docs/spectral/83527ef2dd8c0-extending-rulesets#change-rule-severity]
extends: 
  - spectral:oas
  - spectral:asyncapi
  - spectral:arazzo
rules:
  info-contact: off
  info-description: error
  • ruleset-tweaking-rules.yaml


Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(23) Tweaking Rules



Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(24) My First Rule 

rules:
  info-contact:
    given: $
    then:
      field: info.contact
      function: truthy
  • ruleset-info-contact.yaml
  • Rules have identifiers
  • Rules are applied to parts given with a JSONPath
  • If a given part is found then functions are applied


Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(25) 3rd Party Rulesets

  • Rulesets that (try to) help with better API design
  • Rulesets that (try to) help with better API description
  • Rulesets that (try to) help with standards conformance


Linting OpenAPI with Spectral Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(29) Faster Feedback Cycles



Why Mocking? Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(30) Use Cases for API Mocking

  • Frontend/Backend Parallel Work: Build UIs before the backend exists
  • Design-First Validation: Try out the API contract early
  • Demos and Prototyping: Show stable behavior without real servers
  • Developer Onboarding: Let new devs explore APIs instantly
  • Integration & Error Testing: Simulate edge cases and failures safely

Mocking APIs with Prism Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(32) How to use a Mock Tool

  • Mocking tools come as local or hosted versions
  • OpenAPI serves as the input for the mocking tool
    • The tool looks for paths, methods, and responses
    • Examples and schemas are used for sending responses
  • Mock servers can be started with OpenAPI as their only input
  • Additional options allow to fine-tune the server's behavior


Mocking APIs with Prism Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

OpenAPI and AI: Emerging Patterns of OpenAPI Usage with LLMs Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling

(35) Use Cases for Combining APIs with AI

  • Helping API design by using LLM tooling for text and images
  • Generative AI creating or updating OpenAPI specs from prompts
  • LLMs helping developers write better documentation and examples
  • Natural-language search across large API landscapes
  • Agents discovering and using APIs autonomously


OpenAPI and AI: Emerging Patterns of OpenAPI Usage with LLMs Erik Wilde: The Ecosystem of OpenAPI: Practices and Tooling
